summary: A "fiscal court" is a specialized judicial body within the organization of the legal system, primarily tasked with adjudicating disputes related to fiscal matters, such as taxation and public finance. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, fiscal courts play a crucial role in ensuring compliance with fiscal regulations and the equitable application of tax laws. They address cases involving both public authorities and private entities, thereby contributing to the integrity of the financial system. The decisions rendered by fiscal courts can significantly impact fiscal policy and the enforcement of EU financial regulations, ensuring accountability and transparency in public finance management.
